Infinite Family of Elliptic Curves with Torsion Subgroup Z/7Z and Mordell-Weil rank >= 1 for all but finitely many t.

Our curves are given in short Weierstrauss form; y^2 = x^3 + a_4(t) x + a_6(t), where

a_4(t) = -27*t^16 + 216*t^15 + 216*t^14 - 4536*t^13 + 5292*t^12 + 10584*t^11 - 58968*t^10 - 735480*t^9 + 275454*t^8 + 4246344*t^7 - 12070296*t^6 + 24698520*t^5 - 42681492*t^4 + 49601160*t^3 - 37633896*t^2 + 35429400*t - 22851963,

and

a_6(t) = 54*t^24 - 648*t^23 + 648*t^22 + 17928*t^21 - 58644*t^20 - 84888*t^19 + 646056*t^18 - 4663656*t^17 + 18256266*t^16 + 63974448*t^15 - 301043952*t^14 + 402730704*t^13 + 609484392*t^12 - 2170409904*t^11 + 5384487312*t^10 - 17208004176*t^9 + 38179206954*t^8 - 82948098600*t^7 + 175384505448*t^6 - 284139536472*t^5 + 378103265388*t^4 - 421713313848*t^3 + 353901442248*t^2 - 206968634568*t + 64311801174.
